titleStmt.title: Songs in the new opera, call'd the World in the moon
titleStmt.author: Purcell, Daniel, 1660?-1717.
Clarke, Jeremiah, 1669?-1707. aut
Settle, Elkanah, 1648-1724. World in the moon. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Sould by I: Walsh musicall instrument maker in ordinary to his Majesty, at the Golden Harpe and Ho-boy, in Catherine-Street near Summersett House in the Strand, and I. Hare musicall instrument seller at he Golden Violl in St. Paules Church-yard, and at his shopp in Freemans-yard in Cornhill,

notesStmt.note: Song lyrics set to music by Daniel Purcell and Jeremiah Clarke, the words attributed to Elkanah Settle.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: Catherine-Street near Summersett House in the Strand
he Golden Violl in St. Paules Church-yard
his shopp in Freemans-yard in Cornhill
ordinary to his Majesty, at the Golden Harpe
